description:
In MATLAB, there is a function called transform which can transform an n x n matrix into a new one with a different size r x c keeping its original data.

You are given an n x n matrix and two integers r and c representing the number of rows and the number of columns of the wanted transformed matrix.

The transformed matrix should be filled with all the elements of the original matrix in the same row-traversing order as they were.

If the transform operation with given parameters is possible and legal, output the new transformed matrix; Otherwise, output the original matrix.

#### Example
##### Input 

```
2 1 4
1 2
3 4
```
##### Output
`1 2 3 4` 

Constraints:  

```
1 <= n <= 100  
1 <= r, c <= 300  
(-1000) <= mat[i][j] <= 1000
```

##### Input Format:

```
first line contains n , r, c respectively      
next n line contains n elements each  
```

##### Output Format:

```

A new matrix with r rows and c coloumns or the original matrix
```
title: Matrix Transform
